seo.title: Garmin HRM-Run™ | Heart Rate Monitor
seo.ogDescription: The HRM-Run heart rate monitor provides real-time feedback on running form by sensing torso movement to compute running form metrics

overviewTab.title: Overview
overviewTab.content:
The HRM-Run heart rate monitor provides the most advanced running metrics to high-end Garmin Forerunner® running watches. The strap is seamlessly comfortable and easily adjustable while the module is small, lightweight and fits entirely within the width strap.

HRM-Run provides 6 running dynamics metrics:

  • Cadence — number of steps per minute
  • Vertical oscillation — degree of ‘bounce’ in your running motion; displays the vertical motion of your torso, measured in centimeters for each step
  • Ground contact time — amount of time in each step that you spend on the ground while running; measured in milliseconds
  • Ground contact time balance — displays the left/right balance of your ground contact time while running (displays a percentage); for example, 53.2 with an arrow pointing left or right
  • Stride length — length of your stride from 1 footfall to the next; measured in meters
  • Vertical ratio — ratio of vertical oscillation to stride length (displays a percentage); a lower number typically indicates better running form

This real-time data can help athletes take their performance to the next level by showing them where they can improve their running form.

additionalTab.title: HRM Comparison
additionalTab.content:
HRM-Dual™ HRM-Run™ HRM-Swim™ HRM-Tri™ HRM-Pro™
Real-time heart rate transmission via ANT® connectivity (2.4 GHz) when out of water
Supports heart rate variability (HRV)
Transmits real-time heart rate and supports HRV via Bluetooth® technology to compatible devices and apps
Number of concurrent connections supported ANT: No limit Bluetooth Low Energy: 2 ANT: No limit ANT: No limit ANT: No limit ANT: No limit Bluetooth Low Energy: 2
Running Dynamics1
Stores and forwards heart rate data for swimming or stand-alone use cases1
Swim interval heart rate stats1
Pairs with Garmin Connect™ app2
Stand-alone activity monitoring (steps, all-day heart rate, calories and intensity minutes) using Physio TrueUp
BATTERY LIFE 3.5 years (using 1 hour per day) 12 months (using 1 hour per day) 18 months (swimming 3 hours per week) 10 months (tri training 1 hour per day) 12 months (tri training 1 hour per day)
water resistance. 1 ATM 5 ATM 5 ATM 5 ATM 5 ATM
Detachable module
Size range 25"–52" (64–132 cm) 23.5"–42" (60–106 cm) With included strap extender: 23.5"–56" (60–142 cm) 23"–57" (58–145 cm) 23.5″–42″ (60–106 cm) With included strap extender: 23.5″–56″ (60–142 cm) 23.5″–42″ (60–106 cm) With optional strap extender: 23.5″–56″ (60–142 cm)
Designed to stay in place during pool swimming

1 Not all Garmin wearables are compatible with this feature; check compatibility of your Garmin wearable device.

2 Requires app on your compatible smartphone; see Garmin.com/ble. Garmin Connect can be used to view settings and receive firmware updates. The app does not support viewing of real-time heart rate data from heart rate straps.

The Bluetooth word mark and logos are registered trademarks owned by Bluetooth SIG, Inc. and any use of such marks by Garmin is under license.

specsTab.title: Specs
specsTab.content:
Physical Specifications

  • Unit dimensions (LxWxD): 23.5”-56.0” x 1.2” x 0.5” (60.0 - 142.0 x 3.0 x 1.2 cm)
  • Weight: 2.1 oz (59 g)
  • Module size: 29.4 x 51.4 x 8.5 mm
  • Module weight: 1.7 oz (49 g)
  • Size adjustment: Bi-fold
  • Sizing range: 23.5”-56.0” (60.0 - 142.0 cm)
  • Battery: CR2032
  • Battery life: Up to 1 year (approx. 1 hour per day)
  • Water rating: 5 ATM

Additional

  • ANT+® heart rate: yes
  • Supports heart rate variability and advanced heart rate features: yes
  • 2.4 GHz ANT wireless communication protocol: yes
  • Running dynamics: yes
  • Stores and forwards heart rate: no
  • Swim interval heart rate statistics: no
  • Non-slip design for pool swimming: no
  • Pool chemical resistant: no
